head.title: Climate Change Makes Our Hurricanes Worse; In Andrew's Wake

hedline.hl1: Climate Change Makes Our Hurricanes Worse; In Andrew's Wake

block.p: A year ago -- in the early morning of Aug. 24 -- Hurricane Andrew devastated large portions of southern Dade County, Florida. It was the most expensive natural disaster in American history. In the aftermath, your newspaper published an advertisement alerting readers to the tragedy in our community. Those readers opened their hearts and pocketbooks to help Andrew's shattered victims begin to rebuild.

A year ago -- in the early morning of Aug. 24 -- Hurricane Andrew devastated large portions of southern Dade County, Florida. It was the most expensive natural disaster in American history. In the aftermath, your newspaper published an advertisement alerting readers to the tragedy in our community. Those readers opened their hearts and pocketbooks to help Andrew's shattered victims begin to rebuild.

Now, south Dade is on the mend. Progress has not been quick or easy. But without the strong support of good, caring people all across America, it would have been much, much harder. ALVAH H. CHAPMAN JR. Chairman, Will Rebuild! Coral Gables, Fla., Aug. 23, 1993
